Personal Website + Blog Exercise

Assignment

Choose a few personal websites + blogs below, and examine them in relation to the questions below; jot down your answers, and share them for discussion.
Your goal is get a sense of what the key elements of a personal website + blog are and why professionals are creating personal websites + blogs in order to help you design your own and to understand why we're doing so.

Personal Websites + Blogs

  • Academic:
    • Ryan Cordell (Info Science Prof.)
    • Jonathan Reeve (DH + English Grad Student)
    • Ben Schmidt (DH + History Prof.)
    • Amanda Visconti (DH Lab Director)
  • Professional:
    • Sarah Chang (Media Startups)
    • Orestis Georgiou (Tech Research)
    • Rhiannon Navin (Author)
    • Gilbert Simon (Healthcare)

Questions

  • Which websites / blogs do you like / not like? Why?

  • Ethos
    • What impression do these websites / blogs give of their respective creators? How do they give that impression?
    • Why create a personal website / blog? How is it helpful to the creator? Are there any drawbacks to having a personal website / blog?
  • Genre
    • What are the key characteristics of a personal website? How do we recognize a personal website when we see one?
      • What info is in an "About" / "Bio" statement? Start thinking about what you will include in yours.
      • Quickly skim a couple of blog posts. What are the defining characteristics of a blog post? Does blogging / writing for the web have a certain style?
